channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day, CISA Issues Urgent Directive
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day, CISA Issues Urgent Directive

Summary:
Microsoft has issued an emergency out-of-band security update for a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office, tracked as CVE-2026-21509. The flaw, a security feature bypass with a CVSS score of 7.8, is being actively exploited in targeted attacks, allowing threat actors to bypass OLE mitigations via specially crafted Office files. In response, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating that federal agencies apply the patch by February 16, 2026. The vulnerability affects multiple versions of Office, including Office 2016, 2019, LTSC 2021, and Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft has patched a high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2026-21509) in Microsoft Office that is being actively exploited to bypass security features. CISA has issued a directive to patch.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-office-zero-day-cve-2026-21509

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: EU Proposes Major Overhaul of Cybersecurity Act to Strengthen ENISA and Tackle Supply Chain Risks
item.description:
Headline: EU Proposes Major Overhaul of Cybersecurity Act to Strengthen ENISA and Tackle Supply Chain Risks

Summary:
The European Commission has introduced a significant proposal to revise the EU Cybersecurity Act, aiming to fortify the region's defenses against escalating cyber threats. The update seeks to enhance the mandate of the European Union Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA), streamline the cybersecurity certification framework, and introduce new measures to manage ICT supply chain risks. A key and potentially controversial element is the power to identify and restrict high-risk suppliers across 18 critical sectors, which could lead to the exclusion of certain technologies from the EU market and even the withdrawal of already-deployed products.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The European Commission has proposed a revised EU Cybersecurity Act to strengthen ENISA, streamline certification, and address ICT supply chain risks, including the potential exclusion of high-risk suppliers.

Article Slug: eu-proposes-revised-cybersecurity-act-to-counter-growing-threats

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: RansomHub Claims Breach of Apple Supplier Luxshare, Threatens to Leak Stolen CAD Models and Designs
item.description:
Headline: RansomHub Claims Breach of Apple Supplier Luxshare, Threatens to Leak Stolen CAD Models and Designs

Summary:
The RansomHub ransomware group has listed Luxshare, a critical electronics manufacturer for tech giants like Apple, Nvidia, and Tesla, as its latest victim. The threat actors claim to have exfiltrated sensitive intellectual property, including proprietary 3D CAD models and detailed circuit board designs. This attack underscores the increasing trend of targeting vital links in the global technology supply chain. While Luxshare has not yet confirmed the breach, the potential leak of such valuable data poses a significant threat to the competitive advantage of both the manufacturer and its high-profile clients. Security vendors like Check Point have already released signatures to detect the RansomHub threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The RansomHub ransomware group claims to have breached Luxshare, a major supplier for Apple and Nvidia, allegedly stealing sensitive intellectual property like CAD models and circuit designs.

Article Slug: ransomhub-claims-cyberattack-on-apple-supplier-luxshare

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers Leaked on Dark Web Following Everest Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Headline: Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers Leaked on Dark Web Following Everest Ransomware Attack

Summary:
A massive database allegedly containing the personal information of 72 million Under Armour customers has been leaked on a dark web forum. This data dump is the direct result of a November 2025 ransomware attack claimed by the Everest ransomware group, who reportedly published the data after ransom negotiations failed. The compromised information is said to include full names, email addresses, phone numbers, physical locations, and purchase histories, putting millions of customers at risk of identity theft, phishing, and other malicious activities. A class-action lawsuit has already been filed against Under Armour in the U.S. over the breach.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Following a ransomware attack by the Everest group, a database with personal data of 72 million Under Armour customers has been leaked on the dark web, exposing names, emails, and locations.

Article Slug: under-armour-customer-data-leaked-on-dark-web-after-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 10.2 Million Raaga Music Streamer User Records Leaked, Exposing Weakly Hashed Passwords
item.description:
Headline: 10.2 Million Raaga Music Streamer User Records Leaked, Exposing Weakly Hashed Passwords

Summary:
Indian music streaming service Raaga has suffered a major data breach, with a database containing 10.2 million user records surfacing on criminal forums. The data, reportedly stolen in December 2025, includes sensitive personally identifiable information such as names, email addresses, and geographic locations. Most critically, user passwords were found to be protected only with unsalted MD5 hashes, a notoriously weak and outdated hashing algorithm. This makes the passwords trivial to crack, exposing users to a high risk of credential stuffing attacks against other online services and targeted phishing campaigns.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Indian music platform Raaga suffers a data breach exposing 10.2 million user records, including names, emails, and passwords stored with weak, unsalted MD5 hashing, posing a high risk of credential stuffing.

Article Slug: data-of-10-million-raaga-users-surfaces-on-criminal-forums

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cyberattack Cripples Digital Services at Germany's Dresden State Art Collections
item.description:
Headline: Cyberattack Cripples Digital Services at Germany's Dresden State Art Collections

Summary:
Germany's Dresden State Art Collections (SKD), one of Europe's most significant museum networks, has been hit by a cyberattack that caused widespread disruption to its digital infrastructure. The attack knocked out the SKD's online ticketing system, visitor services, museum shop website, and internal communications. On-site services were severely impacted, with ticket sales reverting to cash-only. While the operational disruption is significant, the SKD has stated that there is currently no evidence that any data, including sensitive collection or visitor data, was stolen during the incident. The attack highlights the increasing vulnerability of cultural institutions to cyber threats.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Other

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A cyberattack on Germany's Dresden State Art Collections (SKD) has disabled its digital infrastructure, including online ticketing and visitor services, forcing a reversion to cash-only operations.

Article Slug: cyberattack-disrupts-operations-at-dresden-state-art-collections

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "VoidLink": Researchers Uncover First AI-Authored Cloud-Native Linux Malware Framework
item.description:
Headline: "VoidLink": Researchers Uncover First AI-Authored Cloud-Native Linux Malware Framework

Summary:
Security researchers have discovered "VoidLink," a new and sophisticated cloud-native Linux malware framework that appears to have been almost entirely written by an AI model under the direction of a single human operator. The speed of development was remarkable, with a functional implant being created in less than a week. This discovery marks a potential paradigm shift in the threat landscape, demonstrating that AI can be leveraged to rapidly create complex malware, lowering the barrier to entry for threat actors and accelerating the pace of new threat creation. The actor used a methodology dubbed 'Spec Driven Development' (SDD), using the AI for more than just code generation.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: Check Point Research has uncovered "VoidLink," a cloud-native Linux malware framework almost entirely authored by AI, demonstrating the potential for rapid, automated creation of sophisticated cyber threats.

Article Slug: ai-authored-linux-malware-framework-voidlink-discovered

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Widespread Phishing Campaign Abuses Microsoft Teams Guest Invites to Target 6,000+ Users
item.description:
Headline: Widespread Phishing Campaign Abuses Microsoft Teams Guest Invites to Target 6,000+ Users

Summary:
A large-scale phishing campaign is abusing Microsoft Teams' guest invitation feature to target thousands of users with fake billing notices. Researchers at Check Point have observed over 12,000 phishing emails sent to more than 6,100 users, primarily in the manufacturing, technology, and education sectors in the United States. Attackers create Teams groups with finance-related names and send guest invitations to targets. The invitation email, which comes from a legitimate Microsoft address, contains obfuscated text that appears to be a billing notification, lending it an air of authenticity and increasing the likelihood that a user will click the malicious link.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A large-scale phishing campaign is abusing Microsoft Teams guest invitations to send fake billing notices, targeting over 6,000 users in the US across manufacturing, technology, and education sectors.

Article Slug: microsoft-teams-phishing-campaign-abuses-guest-invitations

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New "Osiris" Ransomware Disables Security Software Using Malicious "Poortry" Driver
item.description:
Headline: New "Osiris" Ransomware Disables Security Software Using Malicious "Poortry" Driver

Summary:
A new ransomware family named "Osiris" has been identified, employing a 'living off the land' strategy by combining legitimate tools with custom malware. A key component of its attack is a malicious driver called "Poortry," which masquerades as a Malwarebytes component to terminate security software processes, effectively disabling endpoint protection. Before encryption, the Osiris operators use the legitimate data transfer utility Rclone to exfiltrate stolen data to Wasabi cloud storage. This combination of defense evasion and use of legitimate tools makes the ransomware particularly difficult to detect.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The new Osiris ransomware uses a malicious driver, Poortry, to disable security software and abuses the legitimate tool Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage before encrypting victim files.

Article Slug: new-osiris-ransomware-uses-legitimate-tools-for-attacks

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Zoom Patches Critical RCE Flaw in Node Multimedia Routers That Could Let a Participant Hijack Meetings
item.description:
Headline: Zoom Patches Critical RCE Flaw in Node Multimedia Routers That Could Let a Participant Hijack Meetings

Summary:
Zoom has released a security update to address a critical command injection vulnerability, CVE-2026-22844, in its Zoom Node Multimedia Routers. These routers are a key component in on-premise and hybrid meeting deployments. The flaw could allow a malicious participant within a meeting to execute arbitrary code remotely on the vulnerable router, potentially leading to a compromise of meeting integrity and the underlying infrastructure. Zoom has patched the vulnerability in version 5.2.1716.0 and later and states there is no evidence of active exploitation in the wild. Customers are urged to update their systems immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Zoom has patched a critical command injection vulnerability (CVE-2026-22844) in its Node Multimedia Routers that could allow for remote code execution. Users are urged to update to version 5.2.1716.0 or later.

Article Slug: zoom-patches-critical-rce-flaw-in-node-multimedia-routers-cve-2026-22844

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fortinet Confirms Active Exploitation of FortiCloud SSO Bypass on Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Confirms Active Exploitation of FortiCloud SSO Bypass on Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls

Summary:
Fortinet has confirmed that a critical Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication bypass vulnerability affecting FortiCloud is being actively exploited in the wild. The attacks, linked to CVE-2025-59718 and CVE-2025-59719, are reportedly successful even against fully patched FortiGate firewalls. Attackers are exploiting the flaw by sending specially crafted SAML messages to bypass authentication. Once inside, they are creating persistent administrative accounts, enabling VPN access, and exfiltrating firewall configurations. This allows for long-term persistence and deep network compromise. Customers are urged to review Fortinet's advisories and take immediate mitigation steps.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Fortinet confirms active exploitation of a critical SSO authentication bypass (CVE-2025-59718, CVE-2025-59719) on patched FortiGate firewalls, leading to persistent access and configuration theft.

Article Slug: fortinet-confirms-active-exploitation-of-forticloud-sso-bypass

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
Headline: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026

Summary:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highlights a shift in focus towards emerging, sophisticated threats. Alongside AI, the report emphasizes the persistent dangers of major supply chain vulnerabilities and the continued high impact of ransomware. The findings, drawn from extensive data including over 1,200 targeted alerts in 2025, urge healthcare organizations to move towards a more proactive and resilient security posture.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Ransomware

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: The 2026 Health-ISAC threat report identifies AI-enabled attacks as the top concern for the healthcare sector, followed by supply chain vulnerabilities and the persistent threat of ransomware.

Article Slug: health-isac-report-highlights-ai-driven-attacks-as-top-concern-for-2026

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
Headline: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks

Summary:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million unique email addresses. The compromised data reportedly includes sensitive customer information such as full names, phone numbers, physical locations, and purchase histories. This breach places a huge number of individuals at significant risk for targeted phishing campaigns, identity theft, and other fraudulent activities.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group claims to have breached Under Armour, leaking a massive dataset allegedly containing the personal information of over 72 million customers on the dark web.

Article Slug: everest-ransomware-claims-under-armour-breach-leaks-data-of-72m-customers

Published Date: Thu, 22 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Zoom & GitLab Race to Patch Critical Flaws, Including a 9.9 CVSS RCE Bug
item.description:
Headline: Zoom & GitLab Race to Patch Critical Flaws, Including a 9.9 CVSS RCE Bug

Summary:
Both Zoom and GitLab have released critical security updates to address several high-severity vulnerabilities. The most severe flaw, CVE-2026-22844, is a remote code execution vulnerability in Zoom Node Multimedia Routers (MMRs) with a near-perfect CVSS score of 9.9. This flaw could allow an unauthenticated attacker with network access to compromise the devices. GitLab's updates address multiple vulnerabilities, including two high-severity flaws (CVE-2025-13927 and CVE-2025-13928) that could allow an unauthenticated user to cause denial-of-service conditions. Users of all affected products are urged to apply the patches immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Zoom and GitLab release critical security patches. Zoom addresses CVE-2026-22844, a 9.9 CVSS RCE flaw in Node Multimedia Routers, while GitLab fixes several high-severity DoS and 2FA bypass vulnerabilities.

Article Slug: zoom-and-gitlab-patch-critical-flaws-including-9-9-cvss-vulnerability

Published Date: Thu, 22 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 22 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

item.title: UPDATE: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
Headline: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV

Summary:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked to the Inc group. More significantly, Osiris uses a custom-developed and signed malicious driver, 'Abyssworker' (aka Poortry), in a Bring-Your-Own-Vulnerable-Driver (BYOVD) attack to terminate security software. This driver and its loader, 'Stonestop,' have been previously associated with the Medusa ransomware gang. The use of these advanced, borrowed TTPs suggests Osiris is operated by experienced actors, possibly former affiliates of other groups.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The new Osiris ransomware strain shows links to Medusa and Inc groups, using a custom-signed malicious driver (Poortry/Abyssworker) to disable security software in a sophisticated BYOVD attack.

Article Slug: new-osiris-ransomware-linked-to-medusa-and-inc-gang-ttps

Published Date: Fri, 23 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 23 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Warning: Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls Are Being Compromised via New SSO Bypass
item.description:
Headline: Warning: Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls Are Being Compromised via New SSO Bypass

Summary:
Security analysts are warning of a new wave of attacks compromising even fully patched Fortinet FortiGate firewalls. The activity, observed since January 15, 2026, allows attackers to bypass SAML-based single sign-on (SSO) authentication to gain administrative access. The attacks result in unauthorized configuration changes, creation of persistent user accounts, and exfiltration of device configurations. Fortinet has reportedly identified a new, distinct attack path related to previously disclosed vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-59718, CVE-2025-59719), suggesting existing patches may not be fully effective.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Security alert: A new attack is compromising even fully patched Fortinet FortiGate firewalls by exploiting a new SAML SSO authentication bypass, granting attackers administrative access.

Article Slug: fully-patched-fortigate-firewalls-compromised-via-sso-bypass

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

item.title: NEW: New QuantumLeap Ransomware Demands $50M, Halts Global Shipments at NaviGistics
item.description:
Headline: New QuantumLeap Ransomware Demands $50M, Halts Global Shipments at NaviGistics

Summary:
The global logistics firm NaviGistics has suffered a catastrophic cyberattack from a new ransomware strain dubbed 'QuantumLeap'. The attack, orchestrated by a group calling itself 'Entropy Collective', has encrypted critical systems and brought the company's worldwide shipping and freight operations to a standstill. The threat actors gained initial access via a compromised VPN account lacking multi-factor authentication, demonstrating a sophisticated lateral movement campaign before deploying the payload. The group is demanding a $50 million ransom and has threatened to leak over 2 terabytes of exfiltrated data, including sensitive customer and financial records. This incident highlights the extreme vulnerability of the global supply chain to targeted cyber-extortion and the devastating operational and financial impact of modern ransomware attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new ransomware group, Entropy Collective, has deployed QuantumLeap ransomware against logistics firm NaviGistics, causing a global operational shutdown and demanding a $50 million ransom.

Article Slug: quantumleap-ransomware-cripples-global-logistics-giant-navigistics

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Urgent Patch Required: Critical RCE Zero-Day (CVE-2026-12345) in NexusFlow API Gateway Under Active Attack
item.description:
Headline: Urgent Patch Required: Critical RCE Zero-Day (CVE-2026-12345) in NexusFlow API Gateway Under Active Attack

Summary:
A critical pre-authentication remote code execution (RCE) zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2026-12345, is being actively exploited in the wild against the popular NexusFlow API Gateway. The flaw, which carries the maximum CVSS score of 10.0, allows unauthenticated attackers to gain complete control of vulnerable servers by sending a single, specially crafted HTTP request. Security firm Horizon Security Labs discovered the exploitation during a breach investigation. The vulnerability is wormable, creating a risk of rapid, widespread compromise. NexusFlow's parent company, Voltara, has released an emergency patch (version 3.8.1) and is urging all customers to update immediately. CISA has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating federal agencies to patch by February 9, 2026.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Urgent patch required for critical zero-day RCE vulnerability CVE-2026-12345 (CVSS 10.0) in NexusFlow API Gateway, which is being actively exploited in the wild for full server takeover.

Article Slug: critical-rce-zero-day-in-nexusflow-api-gateway-actively-exploited

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Medusa Ransomware Exploits Cybersecurity Gaps, Escalating Attacks Across Africa
item.description:
Headline: Medusa Ransomware Exploits Cybersecurity Gaps, Escalating Attacks Across Africa

Summary:
Ransomware attacks are a pervasive and highly damaging threat across the African continent, where a significant cybersecurity skills and resources gap creates a fertile ground for cybercriminals. Notorious ransomware groups, including Medusa, are increasingly targeting organizations in the region, leveraging double extortion tactics to maximize pressure on their victims. These attacks involve not only encrypting critical data but also stealing it and threatening public release if the ransom is not paid. Key sectors such as healthcare, finance, and critical infrastructure are prime targets. According to reports, a high percentage of African organizations hit by ransomware end up paying the ransom, perpetuating the cycle of attacks. The situation underscores an urgent need for increased investment in cybersecurity infrastructure, skills development, and awareness across the continent.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Explore how ransomware groups like Medusa are exploiting cybersecurity gaps across Africa, using double extortion to attack critical industries and pressure victims into paying large ransoms.

Article Slug: medusa-ransomware-group-escalates-attacks-in-africa

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Nation-State Actor 'SteelHydra' (APT47) Deploys 'GeoShifter' ICS Malware to Spy on Geothermal Energy Firms
item.description:
Headline: Nation-State Actor 'SteelHydra' (APT47) Deploys 'GeoShifter' ICS Malware to Spy on Geothermal Energy Firms

Summary:
The nation-state threat actor 'SteelHydra' (also tracked as APT47) is behind a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign targeting the geothermal energy sector. According to research from Mandiant, the campaign has impacted firms in the United States, Canada, and Iceland. The attackers are using a novel, custom-built malware framework called 'GeoShifter', which is specifically designed to operate in Industrial Control System (ICS) environments and interface with SCADA/PLC systems from vendors like Siemens and Schneider Electric. The initial infection vector is a spear-phishing campaign that deploys a backdoor named 'PipeDreamer'. The ultimate goal of the campaign appears to be the theft of intellectual property and operational data related to geothermal technology, which could be used for economic advantage or to plan future disruptive attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: The nation-state group SteelHydra (APT47) is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign against the geothermal energy sector using novel ICS malware called GeoShifter to steal intellectual property.

Article Slug: apt-steelhydra-targets-geothermal-energy-sector-with-novel-ics-malware

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Apple & Google Issue Emergency Patches for 'GhostTouch' Zero-Click RCE Flaw (CVE-2026-23456)
item.description:
Headline: Apple & Google Issue Emergency Patches for 'GhostTouch' Zero-Click RCE Flaw (CVE-2026-23456)

Summary:
Apple and Google have released coordinated, emergency security updates to fix a critical zero-click remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, dubbed 'GhostTouch' and tracked as CVE-2026-23456. The flaw exists in a core open-source graphics rendering library used by both iOS and Android, affecting billions of smartphones and tablets worldwide. The vulnerability can be exploited by sending a victim a specially crafted image file via messaging apps or email, requiring no user interaction to achieve code execution. Researchers at The Citizen Lab discovered the flaw being actively used by a commercial surveillance vendor to deploy spyware against high-risk individuals. CISA has added the CVE to its KEV catalog, and all users are urged to update to iOS 19.2.1, iPadOS 19.2.1, or the latest Android security patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Mobile Security, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A critical zero-click RCE vulnerability (CVE-2026-23456) called 'GhostTouch' is being actively exploited. Apple and Google have released emergency patches for iOS and Android. Update now.

Article Slug: apple-google-release-emergency-patches-for-ghosttouch-zero-click-flaw

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'SilentVoice' Phishing Campaign Weaponizes AI Deepfake Audio to Bypass MFA
item.description:
Headline: 'SilentVoice' Phishing Campaign Weaponizes AI Deepfake Audio to Bypass MFA

Summary:
A sophisticated social engineering campaign named 'SilentVoice' is successfully bypassing multi-factor authentication (MFA) by using AI-generated deepfake audio of corporate executives. According to researchers at Proofpoint, attackers clone an executive's voice from public audio samples and then use it in a vishing (voice phishing) call to a subordinate employee. The deepfake voice creates a sense of urgency, tricking the employee into entering their credentials on a fake site and then approving the subsequent MFA push notification sent to their device. This highly convincing technique circumvents the protection offered by many common MFA methods, leading to full account takeover. The campaign has already resulted in successful breaches and financial fraud, highlighting the emerging threat of AI-weaponized social engineering.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Learn about the 'SilentVoice' campaign, a sophisticated attack where criminals use AI-generated deepfake audio of executives to bypass MFA and gain access to corporate accounts.

Article Slug: silentvoice-phishing-campaign-uses-ai-deepfakes-to-bypass-mfa

item.title: NEW: NPM Package 'js-utility-kit' Hijacked in Supply Chain Attack to Steal Crypto Keys and Credentials
item.description:
Headline: NPM Package 'js-utility-kit' Hijacked in Supply Chain Attack to Steal Crypto Keys and Credentials

Summary:
A significant software supply chain attack has compromised the popular NPM package 'js-utility-kit', which is downloaded over 5 million times per week. Security firm Snyk discovered that malicious versions (2.1.8, 2.1.9, and 2.2.1) were published after the maintainer's account was hijacked via a credential stuffing attack. The compromised packages contained a post-install script that downloaded and executed a sophisticated information stealer. The malware was designed to steal cryptocurrency private keys, browser extension data for crypto wallets, and sensitive credentials such as environment variables and cloud provider CLI configurations from developers' machines and CI/CD pipelines. The NPM security team has removed the malicious versions, but any project that installed them between January 24 and 26 is considered compromised and requires immediate auditing and credential rotation.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A major supply chain attack hit the popular NPM package 'js-utility-kit', installing malware to steal cryptocurrency keys and developer credentials. Check your projects for malicious versions.

Article Slug: popular-npm-package-js-utility-kit-compromised-in-supply-chain-attack

item.title: NEW: Fintech Startup VoltPay Leaks 5 Million Customer Records via Misconfigured Cloud Database
item.description:
Headline: Fintech Startup VoltPay Leaks 5 Million Customer Records via Misconfigured Cloud Database

Summary:
The financial technology startup VoltPay has confirmed a massive data breach affecting approximately 5 million users. The leak was caused by a misconfigured Elasticsearch database that was left publicly accessible on the internet without a password for over three months. A security researcher discovered and reported the exposure. The leaked data includes highly sensitive information: full names, email addresses, phone numbers, physical addresses, dates of birth, hashed passwords, and full transaction histories. The last four digits of credit card and bank account numbers were also exposed. This incident, attributed to 'human error during a server migration', places millions of users at significant risk of identity theft and targeted phishing attacks, and has reportedly triggered investigations by U.S. and European regulators.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Fintech app VoltPay exposed the sensitive personal and financial records of 5 million customers after leaving an Elasticsearch database unprotected on the internet for over three months.

Article Slug: fintech-startup-voltpay-exposes-5-million-customer-records-in-cloud-leak

item.title: NEW: CISA Issues Directive Mandating Federal Agencies Prepare for Post-Quantum Cryptography
item.description:
Headline: CISA Issues Directive Mandating Federal Agencies Prepare for Post-Quantum Cryptography

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-03, a landmark mandate requiring Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies to prepare for the transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC). The directive addresses the future threat posed by quantum computers capable of breaking current public-key encryption standards. Agencies are required to inventory all systems using public-key cryptography by September 2026 and submit a comprehensive migration roadmap by March 2027. The initiative prioritizes the protection of systems with long-term data confidentiality needs, which are vulnerable to 'harvest now, decrypt later' attacks. This directive establishes the foundational steps for a coordinated, government-wide migration to NIST-standardized PQC algorithms.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-03, requiring U.S. federal agencies to begin the transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC) to counter future quantum threats.

Article Slug: cisa-issues-directive-on-post-quantum-cryptography-readiness

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: International Operation 'Echidna' Dismantles 'Crimson Market' Dark Web Hub, 50+ Arrested
item.description:
Headline: International Operation 'Echidna' Dismantles 'Crimson Market' Dark Web Hub, 50+ Arrested

Summary:
A coordinated international law enforcement action, codenamed 'Operation Echidna', has successfully dismantled 'Crimson Market', one of the largest dark web marketplaces for cybercrime tools and stolen data. The operation, involving the FBI, Europol, and the UK's NCA, resulted in the seizure of the market's server infrastructure and the arrest of over 50 individuals worldwide, including its alleged administrator. Crimson Market was a key hub for selling billions of stolen credentials, malware-as-a-service (including ransomware and info-stealers), and phishing kits. The 18-month investigation involved undercover operations to trace cryptocurrency transactions. The takedown represents a major disruption to the cybercrime economy, and data from the seized servers is expected to lead to further arrests.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A global law enforcement operation called 'Echidna' has successfully taken down 'Crimson Market', a major dark web marketplace, resulting in over 50 arrests and the seizure of its servers.

Article Slug: operation-echidna-dismantles-crimson-market-dark-web-hub

item.title: NEW: Volt Typhoon Linked to Breach at U.S. Water Utility, Exfiltrating Operational Documents
item.description:
Headline: Volt Typhoon Linked to Breach at U.S. Water Utility, Exfiltrating Operational Documents

Summary:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Volt Typhoon has been attributed to a data breach at the Park County Water District in Colorado. According to a joint advisory from CISA, the FBI, and the NSA, the hackers exploited a known vulnerability in an internet-facing network appliance to gain initial access. Consistent with their known TTPs, Volt Typhoon then used 'living off the land' techniques, leveraging built-in network administration tools to blend in and evade detection. The attackers moved laterally within the IT network and exfiltrated sensitive operational documents, including engineering schematics and maintenance schedules. While officials stated that the operational technology (OT) network and water supply were not affected, the incident highlights the group's continued focus on reconnaissance against U.S. critical infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Chinese APT group Volt Typhoon has been linked to a data breach at a U.S. water utility, where they exploited a vulnerability and used 'living off the land' techniques to steal operational data.

Article Slug: volt-typhoon-linked-to-data-breach-at-us-water-utility

item.title: NEW: Researchers Detail 'ChronoStealer', a New Modular Info-Stealing Malware-as-a-Service
item.description:
Headline: Researchers Detail 'ChronoStealer', a New Modular Info-Stealing Malware-as-a-Service

Summary:
Security researchers at Check Point have published a deep-dive analysis of 'ChronoStealer', a new and highly modular information-stealing malware sold on a subscription basis in underground forums. This Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) model allows low-skilled criminals to rent the sophisticated tool and its infrastructure for as little as $200 per month. ChronoStealer's core function is to steal credentials from over 50 web browsers and other applications. Its capabilities can be expanded with add-on modules for stealing cryptocurrency wallets, logging keystrokes, and capturing session cookies. The malware uses the Telegram API for C2 communications to better blend in with legitimate traffic. The rise of such user-friendly, powerful MaaS platforms represents a significant force multiplier for the cybercrime ecosystem.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers from Check Point detail 'ChronoStealer', a new modular Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) that makes it easy for criminals to steal credentials, crypto wallets, and more.

Article Slug: researchers-detail-chronostealer-a-new-modular-malware-as-a-service

Published Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 26 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT
